website_summaries.verdict: An inexpensive oven that folds up well for storage or portability, but you're going to need to pick up a better thermometer to cook well with it, and you also need a Coleman camp stove.
pros: Constructed from an aluminized steel that is corrosion-resistant
Folds up quickly for easy storage
Has one rack, which can be set to three different cooking heights
cons: A separate Coleman camp stove is required to make it work
Some reports that the thermometer on the door is off an average of 50 to 75 degrees
Some buyers say this stove is poorly constructed and breaks or warps easily

customer_reviews.title: Great little oven for camping
customer_reviews.text: For the price, size and weight of this, it does an amazing job. For our first use we bought a Betty Crocker chocolate chunk cookie mix and a small disposable fudge pan. I put 2 ceramic bread warmers in the bottom of the oven to help distribute the heat evenly. It took about 5 minutes to get up to 300, then I lowered the heat on the stove and it got to about 340 and stayed there pretty well without further adjustment. The cookie bars were done in 20 minutes and came out perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn F. Hammond

customer_reviews.title: A very nice addition to our campfire cooking experience
customer_reviews.text: A very nice addition to our campfire cooking experience. Watch it closely over a campfire to maintain temp. We baked delicious brownies one night and fresh biscuits for sausage and gravy the next morning. Works well. Only wish is that I could get a larger one. 8" square pans work well, but 13x9 won't fit.
customer_reviews.author: mark r riddell

customer_reviews.title: I love, Love
customer_reviews.text: I love , Love , Love my stove! I purchased this because we live on a sailboat and I was really missing baking. I discovered and this and thought would give it try...I mean the price is right. I use it on my alcohol stove. It fits perfectly over one burner and holds heat well. I find using lowest flame setting will hold temp right around 350. I also added a 10 x 7 stone and it helps balance the heat as well. I have only used it a few times now but in a couple days we made muffins, baked zucchini, baked apples, sweet potato fries and I have bread in now. Loving it.
customer_reviews.author: Rene Spires

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality.  Garbage.
customer_reviews.text: Poorly constructed. The slots that is supposed to hold the oven together don’t fit properly so the oven is lopesided. There is a strong burnt plastic smell upon 1st 2 uses. And then, finally, the handle just broke off as I was transferring it from the counter despite the oven being empty. Not worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Dee A

customer_reviews.title: not that efficient
customer_reviews.text: While our use is unusual, the top of our basement woodstove, this product does not meet our intended use. We were hoping to utilize the free energy cooking surface of our woodstove for baking potatoes. The height of the unit and its thin walls are not very efficient. We need a pretty constant roaring fire going in order to utilize heat for baking, otherwise there is an excessive amount of time, hours, to complete the task.
customer_reviews.author: RG

customer_reviews.title: Great to have 2 racks
customer_reviews.text: Been using these for years..... have to replace about every 3 years or so. If you replace one... keep the inside rack and use it on the new one. Great to have 2 racks. Coleman could make these a bit heavier so they last longer... nobody takes them back packing so, the weight doesn't matter, but how long they last does.
customer_reviews.author: Basecamp

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality assurance !!
customer_reviews.text: Read the owner/ user maual very carefully! Followed the set up instructions exactly. “Lift the top up using the handle and lock in Position. The spot welded handle retainers both fell off . They spot welded to a painted surface, the welds did not fuse the material!!
customer_reviews.author: Robert T. Desautel

customer_reviews.title: expect damaged goods
customer_reviews.text: the first came with large scratches and dents. the second arrived with even more scratches. none are new and is made in china. don't expect quality
customer_reviews.author: Mike Hodge

customer_reviews.title: Collapseable Camper Oven
customer_reviews.text: Yes, we've camped a lot over the past 45 years. It was a bit of a lark to buy the Coleman Camp Oven, something new to try to see if it even worked? I can't even begin to tell you how happy my wife was the first time she baked some cookies in it off our camp stove?! There's a small learning curve for the first couple of batches, but the oven held 325* or better without any problem whatsoever. People are shocked to see muffins, cookies, etc., out in the wild, it's fun to see their expressions. What's more, it's collapses into almost nothing for easy storage.
customer_reviews.author: J Soltani

customer_reviews.title: Great for Emergencies & Camping
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought this one to replace the same model that I've had for over 20 years. It's great for camping or to use with a camp stove for emergencies, which is my main use. Living here in hurricane country, this is one of those luxury items that is more than worth the money when you're without power for a week. It's amazing how something simple like a pan of fresh baked biscuits can make such a difference when you're without power. As I stated, this is my second purchase of this model and I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Myron

customer_reviews.title: Coleman Camp Oven
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camp oven to use with my Coleman camp stove. I had one years ago when we went camping in the Western Sierra Nevada. That was long ago. However, we now have power outages courtesy of PG&E to survive. I remember the variety of dishes I used to make and thought that would be a nice way to get through the days of no power with some really good food. I have made Enchiladas, corn bread, cakes, cookies, baked mac and cheese, yummy 1950's Spanish Rice with bacon, many, many different menu items. Also, small cakes and have used it to warm up other foods. No generator needed. Save that for the refrigerator.
customer_reviews.author: Linda v.

customer_reviews.title: A nice addition to our camping gear
customer_reviews.text: It does what it says it does! We baked cookies and hot pockets very well! It folds down nicely and heated pretty evenly. Only gripes, which are minor, is that the rack doesn't pack into it when folded, so it's easy to misplace. It also does not come with a bag to store it in, enhancing the risk of losing pieces. I couldn't find an extra rack online to purchase, but I'm sure with digging we could. Lastly, finding pans that fit can be a bit of a challenge. A nice accessory set would be great. All that said, it was a nice addition to our gear, and a nice surprise for our group when we broke it out.
customer_reviews.author: R. Shelley

customer_reviews.title: Cooked perfect biscuits! You do have to keep an eye ...
customer_reviews.text: The stove works very well. I used it on my gas stove as a test before camping with my Coleman stove. Cooked perfect biscuits! You do have to keep an eye on the temp and adjust the flame if it gets too hot, but it was very easy to watch the thermometer and anticipate when to make the proper adjustments. Can’t wait to camp now!
customer_reviews.author: JeepRubi

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This camp oven came in a secure box. I took it out of the box and set it up to test it out at home before taking it camping. The thermometer on the oven door reads about 75 degrees low, but it is at least consistent. I just have to remember to make a mental adjustment when pre-heating the oven. It does heat up reasonable fast, and requires a bit of watching to ensure the desired temperature remains steady. This is not too difficult. I've used the oven on a camping trip, baking biscuits, peach cobbler, and pre-cooked chicken breasts. The oven is a nice accessory for camp cooking chores. Well worth the reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last
customer_reviews.text: six months of occasional use and the bottom plate is so warped it will no longer engage the lugs to stay in place. We're quite disappointed. As an oven, it works just fine, but now it's pretty much useless. Without the bottom solidly connected, the rack won't stay in place. I can probably bend the thing back into place but i suspect it'll just bend again. I like the way the product works, but with steel this soft and thin, I can't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Don Elwell

customer_reviews.title: Amazing piece of kit
customer_reviews.text: Had this at a rock festival and on day 2 when everyone was waking up hungover, we had the neighbors saying they thought they smelled biscuits and gravy. Sure enough we brought extra and invited them over. This thing collapses to nothing and heat control is impressive with a small flame. We've done biscuits and gravy, apple & peach cobbler, muffins, cornbread, and pizza bread so far. We have dutch ovens, but for places you can't have a fire, or times when you don't want the cleanup, this is a GREAT alternative. A bonus is that small trays cost nothing for this and can be had at walmart or dollar tree for a buck.
customer_reviews.author: Jon M

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I had my doubts before the purchase. Previously I needed to bring a microwave and a toaster oven in both my truck camper and ice fishing house. This eliminates the need for both. Yes, the temperature gauge is 25 degrees F low. That is easily adjusted once it is known. I can now cook tv dinners, frozen pizzas, homemade bread, etc. Yes, it limits the pan size to 8". But, I simply use pie pans and quarter my pizza accordingly. This alone makes it so I can spend more time fishing. I use aluminum foil pans to reduce the need to wash dishes. I feel like I have been injected into a new era of ice fishing.
customer_reviews.author: Bbells

customer_reviews.title: Great little oven
customer_reviews.text: This little oven is lightweight. I purchased a pizza stone and it distributes the heat well. The thermometer that’s built in is about 100 degrees off. But I expected all of this from reading the reviews. I used an oven thermometer to gauge the actual temperature and came out with six perfect blueberry muffins. I am satisfied. On the temperature gauge you can adjust what it reads on the inside.
customer_reviews.author: gully

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Was a bit skeptical about this item but ordered it anyway and glad I did... it is nice to have an option of cooking a different way while camping especially living in Colorado where there are state wide fire bans in the mountains, hence no camp fires or grills... I purchased an 8 inch terra cotta saucer ( used to catch water under a terra cotta planter) and placed it in the oven to create a more even heating environment. It worked great. I baked chicken wings and root vegetables and it came out perfect! Looking forward to doing more baking in the boonies with this great piece of camping gear
customer_reviews.author: M. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Makes a perfect morning
customer_reviews.text: This is a great addition for anyone's car camping gear. It's kind of heavy, but stores compact when folded. The setup is using a Coleman gas stove, using unleaded gas. I set it on top of the large burner per instructions, and pre heated for about 15 minutes. I then placed a muffin pan on the rack in the middle position. Worked perfectly, although the temperature gauge is a bit wonky. If you're like me, and have a limited tolerance for a lot of fried foods in the morning, this might just be the perfect accessory for you.
customer_reviews.author: sub hunterTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: For a collapsible oven, this works very well.
customer_reviews.text: I had thought about getting one of these for years, but I always put it off, thinking it was too flimsy to be useful. But on a lark, I decided to get one after reading many favorable reviews. As an oven, it works fine. It is flimsy, and it is heavier than I expected. But it works! I have used it, and I'm impressed with how well it does. Now if it just holds together through a few seasons of camping, I'll be pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Cary Alburn

customer_reviews.title: Winner winner!
customer_reviews.text: I can see why this has such a good rating. I purchased it wondering if I would use it. Thank goodness I gave it a try! It's one of my favorite things to cook with while camping. I figured I'd start with something easy so purchased a can of Pillsbury cinnamon rolls. Oh my goodness you could smell them baking! They cooked up absolutely perfect in a little LESS time than the package indicated. Since then I have made several things in this little oven and every single one of them has turned out beautiful. It seems to cook faster than my oven at home. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Nybakken

customer_reviews.title: Great product, very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Due to my oven being broken, I used the camp oven to bake a cake on my stove top using the smallest of burners at the lowest of heat. I placed some aluminum foil around the oven in an attempt to keep the heat in and not heat the house. Worked great and the cake came out perfectly done. Do read the instructions before using. I should add that at the suggestion of a review I read somewhere, I purchased a 10" square pizza stone to better evenly distribute the heat. I got the pizza stone from Williams & Sonoma should you want one.
customer_reviews.author: dagny

customer_reviews.title: It WORKS!
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing little device. I used it for the first time to bake an apple pie while camping and it worked GREAT! I have the Coleman Fold and Go grill and used that as the heat source. I removed the “grill” to give the bottom of the oven direct access to the heat source. The oven fits perfectly on top of it. I preheated by setting the grill to high, put in the pie and 45 minutes later it was done perfectly. I can’t wait to try out other baked goods in there!
customer_reviews.author: SuzanneD

customer_reviews.title: It's much more efficient to bake in this if using a small amount of anything and it works great. I put an 8" round pizza stone i
customer_reviews.text: I used this all the time on my stovetop to bake small amounts of goods. My regular propane oven uses way too much gas. It's much more efficient to bake in this if using a small amount of anything and it works great. I put an 8" round pizza stone in it to help even out the temperature which works really well. I'm going to insulate it next to make it even more efficient.
customer_reviews.author: A. Francis

customer_reviews.title: Use caution, but works well.
customer_reviews.text: I made the mistake of putting it on top of the grill side of my Coleman stove and it melted the grill grate. After removing the grate and setting it on top of the circular burner, it worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: ldavis

customer_reviews.title: ... are holes and gaps in the sides and was pretty easy to keep at the same temperature while cooking
customer_reviews.text: This oven heated up relatively quickly considering that there are holes and gaps in the sides and was pretty easy to keep at the same temperature while cooking! The only issue I have with this oven is that after we got done cooking the bottom had a ring of white that didn’t necessarily look food friendly! However, the food tasted good and the white residue didn’t come off so I guess I will try it again and see what happens! Overall, great oven for the price!
customer_reviews.author: adc.jdc.522

customer_reviews.title: Superb on wood stove
customer_reviews.text: I know it would work beautifully on a propane three burner stove but I wanted to see whether it would cook on a tent stove. I made two loaves of meatloaf inside the oven. It was breezy outside on the deck. It took nearly two hours at about 200 degrees shown on the oven gauge. But my infrared thermometer shows it to be hotter at the bottom of the oven, about 380 degrees but about 165 in the middle. I made the best meatloaf ever. The tent oven was above 650 degrees. Heat transfer is not to good. I ordered a pizza stone for next time. I’m stoked. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Johannes H. Benink Jr.

customer_reviews.title: A campers' "must have"
customer_reviews.text: I have used this this several times for traveling. We don't like to use the oven in our RV so I looked in to reviews on camp ovens. This was highly rated and I see why. It is storable and very easy to use. It bakes food evenly and is very efficient. I can't say enough good things about this product.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Franze

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly like the oven at home...only smaller. I love to cookon my Coleman Dual Fuel stove. And now I enjoy baking too. The oven is made with typical Coleman quality. Works great and is easy to clean. I even made a quiche the other day.
customer_reviews.author: Undeniably Asstastic

customer_reviews.title: Gets hot quick!
customer_reviews.text: I love camping, and I also love baking! My husband bought me this little oven for my birthday and it works very well with my Coleman stove! It'd be great for tent camping or RVing if you'd like to cook outside! Baked up a batch of shortbread and 18 minutes! The recommended time was 30 minutes but as you can see it is golden brown after only 18 minutes! Pleasantly surprised! Wish I had bought one years ago!
customer_reviews.author: Toni

customer_reviews.title: Very lightweight and holds heat well
customer_reviews.text: I need just a little camp oven for small things out and about. We actually used this on a campstove for a preschool (outdoor) project.its very light, easily collapsed, and holds heat steadily. I do feel like it could be easily damaged, dented, or broke, but I will have to use it more to find out. Maybe I feel this way because it’s so light?? However the lightweight is great for camping and being outdoors. I can’t wait to use it more.
customer_reviews.author: tasha

customer_reviews.title: So much fun.
customer_reviews.text: Went camping over Thanksgiving and I wanted our dinner to be somewhat like at home(baked rolls and pies). At first my husband chuckled at me when I proudly showed him my new oven. But after the second day of using it he had nothing but good things to say about it. Every morning we made biscuits and I made a cake and brownies as well and everything turned out delicious. However, the previous reviews are correct, this is not a set and forget it kind of oven. You have to pay attention to the temperature and regulate as necessary. The oven was easy to carry, set up and takes up very little room.
customer_reviews.author: Action J

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I have a tiny house... works great. I would recommend putting something on top to insulate the heat. It went from 350* at full power to 400* at 1/4 power. I use a piece of sheetrock but use something fire proof that your comfortable with.
customer_reviews.author: MaX RaY

customer_reviews.title: It was a very nice treat.
customer_reviews.text: I had seen these ovens years ago but hadn't taken the plunge until now. Why did I wait? The Coleman Camp Oven was a top performer! It made the trip camping with us this sommer and we used it several times for biscuits, pizza and cookies. It was a very nice treat.
customer_reviews.author: naxeTlooC

customer_reviews.title: Awesome purchase
customer_reviews.text: We LOVED this oven! We made pizzas with home made dough. We needed to make several pizzas for adults and kids and I was worried that we wouldn't all get to eat together. BUT, the pizzas cooked up beautifully and quickly-- only about 10 minutes or less per pizza. It was the hit of the camping trip! The one con is that the metal is pretty flimsy and just from folding and unfolding it during our weekend camping trip it is already showing signs of weakening and I am not sure how long it will last. But I would still highly recommend this oven!
customer_reviews.author: JMOLE

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: We've really been enjoying this on our camping trips. It just fits on my Basecamp propane stove. I bought a small pizza stone, which helps to regulate the heat. So far, we used it for nachos, pizza, and biscuits. Just keep an eye on what you're baking. It might take some experimentation to master baking with it.
customer_reviews.author: CDawg

customer_reviews.title: coleman camp oven
customer_reviews.text: this thing works really great. We put it on the two burner propane stove and it heated right up. You have to adjust the shelf some so as not to burn the bun bottoms. But holds the temps. really well. It does get very hot, I know kind of a "thank you captain obvious" statement, but really wear oven mits if you need to touch the outside of it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Given to a friend as a gift
customer_reviews.text: I sent this to a very dear friend who lives in California and due to PG&E turning their power off every time the wind blows , I sent this to her to use on her gas cook top. She has baked cookies in it and says they come out perfect and great for reheating leftovers when she can't use the microwave due to power outages. My friend says she loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: A very nice addition to our campfire cooking experience
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice addition to our Camper & campfire cooking experience. Watch it closely over a campfire though to maintain temp. We baked delicious homemade pizza's one night and fresh biscuits for sausage and gravy the next morning for breakfast and Works well. Only wish would be that I could get a larger one. 8" square pans work well, but 13x9 won't fit.
customer_reviews.author: Guy B.

customer_reviews.title: It really works!
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing little camping oven: folds down to a convenient, small size; keeps the temperature even. We baked cinnamon rolls when we were camping and they came out beautiful when we put them in the middle shelf position. We didn't really know if it would work -- what a nice surprise. Who doesn't love warm frosted cinnamon rolls on a camping trip?!
customer_reviews.author: Jeannie C.

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Weld on handle broke almost immediately! Not the quality I expect from Coleman.
customer_reviews.author: N D

customer_reviews.title: Great Camp Oven!
customer_reviews.text: I can not begin to tell u how impressed I was with this oven, should have bought one years ago! Have always thought about it, but always felt "no way that will work". But it was perfect, baked biscuits and corn bread, and both came out as good as any oven! Only (if any) down fall is it's small and I have a large family, probably get another oven rack. This oven is very well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Anna K. Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camp oven
customer_reviews.text: Awesome camp oven! I use this on a two burner gasoline Coleman camp stove. I can only get it to a little above 350 but so far that hasn't been a problem. I've made pizzas, biscuits, muffins, and bread so far. If you like going the extra mile with your camp cooking and you aren't hiking your stuff in, this should be in your camp kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: John M.

customer_reviews.title: Impressive for what it is!
customer_reviews.text: Had this for two camping seasons. The heat is practice to get it down, then it’s a breeze. It does cook a little uneven, but for being in the woods and just being able to have an “oven” available, I don’t mind rotating a few things around when needed. LOVE how small it is to store. I would give it 5 starts if it cooked completely evenly. Must have
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would love a refund
customer_reviews.text: Oven is warped and won't go together, owned it only a few month and have only used it over the Coleman two burner. Not happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Fresh Cookies and Cinnamon rolls while Camping!
customer_reviews.text: OMG! I cannot say enough good things about this camp oven! I cooked fresh baked cookies, and cinnamon rolls the next morning! Everything turned out amazing! I did follow everyone's recommendation and bought the small pizza stone and placed it at the bottom of the oven to distribute the heat better. Worked PERFECT! Can't wait to cook more things while camping. - Baked Ziti, meat loaf, lasagna!
customer_reviews.author: Farrah Bauer

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this thing
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this thing! Took it camping because my toddler is a picky eater and I wanted to bake him his meals. This worked better than I anticipated. Baked him french fries, chicken nuggets and frozen pizza. All tasted just like home. I was shocked. Also took less time because it gets hot fast. So just keep an eye on it. Only Wish I took cookie dough. Next time! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: E. Perez

customer_reviews.title: Camping essential for longer trips
customer_reviews.text: Love this oven! Made biscuits and cinnamon rolls while camping. Even made meatloaf! I very much agree with other reviews that it runs hot about 50° but that is easy to compensate for if you are aware. Definitely a wonderful addition to my camp kitchen. We go camping for at least a week at a time. This last trip was almost two weeks. Would recommend this oven. Keep in mind it is small to fit on a camp stove. I was glad to take the opportunity at home to figure out what bakeware would fit. With this oven our menu options have opened up greatly. Overall ecstatic with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Iralectrae

customer_reviews.title: Great camp oven!
customer_reviews.text: The wife is a baker and loves this... We joked it was a similar to easy bake oven from childhood days - but actually bakes stuff. Cookies, brownies, muffins all successful so far. Maintaining consistent temps is a challenge - but that's what I'm for in the process I guess. :)
customer_reviews.author: R. Dumont

customer_reviews.title: Nice price for a foldable camping oven.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't actually used it yet, but did inspect the build quality. I like the way it can be disassembled and put away, saving storage space. I don't know about how evenly it cooks yet. Some reviews have mentioned using a pizza stone or other heat-absorbing stone in the bottom to help alleviate hot spots.
customer_reviews.author: bskousen

customer_reviews.title: Great little camping oven for the price
customer_reviews.text: I was tempted to purchase the camp chef oven but decided to get this instead, as I already owned two camping stoves. This worked flawlessly, and was a breeze to pack up and store. I would recommend this if you already own a camping stove. My only complaint, and this goes for most camping items, is I wished it had it's own bag or something to store it in instead of the box it comes in (cardboard is not weather proof-lol).
customer_reviews.author: Haden

customer_reviews.title: Works great if you use it correctly!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. A little flimsy, but that makes it light to carry so I'm cool with it. It needs to be centered with the burner, if it's off centered, certain parts will get red hot and if you leave it on like that too long it could melt. I noticed it before that happened, it's off colored now in that area but still works fine. Heats up fast, works great if you use it correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: Time Proven Design
customer_reviews.text: This is a basic little camp oven whose design has been proven over time. Follow the directions, allow for air flow, and you'll get good use of this oven. I do wish they made a bit heavier duty model, but this one does the trick and can be replaced inexpensively.
customer_reviews.author: Bill of Rights

customer_reviews.title: Be realistic
customer_reviews.text: Its an oven that fits on top of a cook stove. Use a second thermometer to track temperature. I also added some excess ceramic tiles that were leftover in the garage of my house from construction to the bottom of the oven to help hold it down in windy conditions and generate heat. Be vigilant and pay attention. I got cinnamon rolls in the can to come out okay a couple of times making them. Not sure I would use it for anything much more complicated than that. I found it worked best on a Camp Chef 3 burner stove (my preference).
customer_reviews.author: Charles McKenzie

customer_reviews.title: Cheap product, save your money
customer_reviews.text: It worked well at first. We even cooked a ham & mini pizza’s in it. But we only had it for one summer and the bottom fell out of it and the latch broke off after just 4 uses, rendering it completely useless. Cooks slowly and takes awhile to heat up when it’s windy. It also takes a lot of propane to use. It’s very cheaply made and I would not invest in this product again. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Naomi G.

customer_reviews.title: I’m a pretty good baker, my wife tells me.
customer_reviews.text: I saw one of these in an antique store and they were asking more for it than a new one so I ordered this and it’s sitting in my camper unused but can’t wait to use it newt time we go off somewhere. Home made biscuits and chocolate chip cookies, can’t beat that!
customer_reviews.author: paul burkett

customer_reviews.title: Stay on top of the dial.
customer_reviews.text: It's great in every way except they only give you one rack and Coleman does not sell "replacement" racks. You'll be fine in most cases but having all three would have been nice. There is a bit more heat at the bottom and cooler at the top which is the antithesis of standard oven where the top is usually the hottest. If your using a camp fuel stove you really have to be on top of the output of the burner at they "bleed" pressure quicker than propane and you end up chasing the temperature. But hey, you're camping, what the heck else do you have to do!
customer_reviews.author: Daryl P.

customer_reviews.title: Good oven but takes longer to bake things
customer_reviews.text: Love this oven as can be used on both the gas kitchen range and the camp stove. The only real drawback is that the gauge is off and it takes longer to bake at the setting you pick. But, have made biscuits and while they took longer than in the kitchen oven, they turned out fine. Just have to remember that when baking. My suggestion is to experiment with this on the home stove first so you know more of what to expect before using it for camping.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: BAKING and Camping - Oh MY!
customer_reviews.text: The best of both worlds. What is a camping trip without baking? I do not know because this lovely gadget made my camping trip a dream! I love it and it was easy to set up, clean and carry!! I absolutely LOVE this thing!! It is a permanent item on my camping list!!
customer_reviews.author: L. M. Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Great for Small Items
customer_reviews.text: This worked surprisingly well for baking pizza starting with an unbaked dough crust. I placed the oven on the top of my Coleman Roadtrip Gas Grill. Pay attention to the dimensions in the description. It is small, which limits the size of the pan or dish you can place in it to bake your items. I plan to try to bake biscuits in it next camping trip. Really like how it folds up for compact storage.
customer_reviews.author: ATC

customer_reviews.title: Get all the tabs squarely into their slots.
customer_reviews.text: We love this oven not only for camping with the Coleman camp stove but also with our outdoor grill on the side burner. It is great for heating roles and warming. We also use it to bake with on the patio grill when it is too hot to use the oven in our kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: D. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesome! We bought it to tailgate a football game ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! We bought it to tailgate a football game and it was perfect for reheating fried chicken and cooking my jalepeno poppers. Keep in mind that it does take some time since it's sitting on a burner and it's a fairly large box BUT it's worth it. Oh and obviously the outside gets hot. Be careful! Definitely worth the money and its large enough to accommodate a good amount of food.
customer_reviews.author: SSWhite

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love this oven
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this oven. I would give it a 5 if there was some insulation to go around it. My first attempt at corn muffins took an awful lot of heat adjusting but only because of the gusty wind conditions - the heat was getting sucked out, I presume. The next day I made blueberry muffins - no wind. I never had to make any adjustments once it was up to temp.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle C

customer_reviews.title: The best you'll find for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent item for the price. The quality isn't 5 stars, but it does its job, it's cheap, and it's portable. Apparently the thermometer is off by anywhere for 75 - 100 degrees. I have not tested this, but be aware. Excellent camping accessory.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Hampton

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the reasonable price!
customer_reviews.text: I took this out to the patio to try on a Coleman two burner stove before taking it anywhere. It was easy to set up and take down. It did a fantastic job on corn muffin mix and and cookie mix. I took it 25 degrees cooler than recipe suggested. It heated up quickly. The flame was adjusted a few times to keep an even temperature. Nothing got burnt. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Shedan

customer_reviews.title: Made of tissue paper
customer_reviews.text: I was super careful assembling, and dissembling the oven but two of the hinges got tweaked and it was almost impossible to close it again. Be careful not to sneeze when you handle the oven or it might collapse.
customer_reviews.author: ABPosauner

customer_reviews.title: Amazing. You NEED this. Glad I bought it!
customer_reviews.text: You gotta see this thing. It comes in this lilttle flat box, and I could not figure out what was inside. Opened up the package and here was the Coleman camp oven. I didnt even read the directions. Intuitive and easy. Top comes up, sides pop out and wahlah. Oven. Even has a thermometer on the door. Nothing like fresh cupcakes around the campfire. :)
customer_reviews.author: Zipparado

customer_reviews.title: Perfect camp oven
customer_reviews.text: We got this to use on our butane stove & it works great on both if them. It used quite a bit if fuel & took longer when we were in cold weather at a high altitude. Easily baked cookies & biscuits in the expected time when camping.
customer_reviews.author: WanderDeb

customer_reviews.title: Thermostat is inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: Used it for the 1st time last night with a heat diffuser. As reported by others it does take awhile to heat up. I don't think the temperature gauge is very accurate. After the alloted cooking time my brownies were still liquidy in the middle. After an additional 30 minutes cooking they were finally done. They were worth the wait!!
customer_reviews.author: Kirkeywomon

customer_reviews.title: A good value
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bought these several times in nearly 5 years, once for a community and once for myself. Mine lasted 3 years.
customer_reviews.author: cherie L King

customer_reviews.title: Space saving , and ease of use
customer_reviews.text: This little en surprised is big me . Got to the point that I use it at home a lot. Instead of using the big one and waist all that heat and time. We just lit this on the stove and cook small thinks in it. When camping everyone got to check it out ! Down side? I end fiddling them.
customer_reviews.author: giovuspr

customer_reviews.title: Every troop should have one...
customer_reviews.text: Camping never tasted so good! I like a dutch oven or makeshift oven like the next guy....but sometimes ya just want to eat good food NOW! This oven does run hot...as per other reviews. But pot pie and cinnamon rolls# in a timely fashion were so welcomed! As when using the stove....wind can zap the heat pretty quick; so, pick your time and location....or be patient. So glad to have this as part of my kitchen!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very intuitive.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely surprised how easy it is to setup. Very intuitive and user friendly. Can’t wait to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality with reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my sister's family who loves to go camping. They enjoy this gift and have been taking it with them whenever they go camping. The quality is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Y Chang

customer_reviews.title: Bought hubby this for Christmas
customer_reviews.text: My husband goes primitive camping a lot and I thought this would be perfect for him and his friends when they go out to the farm. They have cooked biscuits, pizza etc in this and it works like a charm. He was super excited!
customer_reviews.author: R. Zuiderveen

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!
customer_reviews.text: It's basically awesome. You need to bring the temperature up slow like others have said and you have to watch it. ALSO, the cook time is less then a normal oven so you have to watch closely. I found it to cook/bake about 1/4 less then the normal time asked for. I made cookies, muffins and pizza while camping recently!! It was awesome!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What can I say I do a lot of cooking even when I go camping.
customer_reviews.text: I love camping and I buy a lot of Coleman products. I've had a Coleman stove for years and I've wanted one of these since the first time I saw it. One problem with camping has been the lack of an oven. With all my stoves and grills and even with my Dutch oven there have been things I'm afraid to cook while camping. not any more. the temperature gauge on this allows me to control more precisely measure and control the heat I'm using. Knowing and controlling the heat allows for better quality meals. My meats can be cooked to perfection just the way we like them without having to guess and risk over cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: So fun
customer_reviews.text: We have so much fun with this. We've made quite a few brownies camping! We just put it on top of our Primus burner and voila. It takes watching, can burn food mighty fast, but really - it's an oven. While camping. So much fun!
customer_reviews.author: capucine

customer_reviews.title: A nice, small camp oven
customer_reviews.text: Very cool! (actually very hot) I bought this oven not knowing if it would work on my small Coleman Fold-n-Go single-burner camp stove. Though it's designed for the larger two-burner Coleman stoves, it works just fine on my little one. I successfully baked cinnamon rolls, and cooked a cauliflower casserole without difficulty. The highest temperature I could get with the small stove is 300 degrees F, but that was good enough to cook these items. I like the way it folds almost flat, and it sets up easily. This is a nice product that works well.
customer_reviews.author: Brian P. Lawler

customer_reviews.title: Makes great cornbread for your bbq
customer_reviews.text: Great for baking while camping. I cooked corn bread for my bbq and it came out great. Cons: no second shelf, not easy to regulate temp with gas stove, shelf has no storage so the shelf may get lost after the box is gone
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Thermometer is way off. Over 100 Degrees F.
customer_reviews.text: But that is not too important to me. We use a probe. It heats up fast so start low or you can overshoot. I recommend first time outdoors as it smells a little at first.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Needs a little adaptation
customer_reviews.text: Outside, a calm day is necessary, with the wind screens up on the stove. Uses lots of gas. But also outside, the stove acts faster (hotter) when placed on a grate over the coals; and still better with most of the vents blocked. To use inside my house, I'm going to add another layer of flashing, and adapt it to my wood heating stove. This was my original intention. I believe the Camp Oven is worth what I paid as a base for my further experiments. Thanks, Amazon
customer_reviews.author: anonatall

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful invention!!!!
customer_reviews.text: We've used this oven several times now, and I really like it. No, it's not like turning on the oven at home. You have to keep an eye on the temperature or it will fluctuate a lot. But, making hot biscuits or cinnamon rolls for breakfast, or cornbread to go with dinner is wonderful when you are out camping! We love this little item and it's in our camper along with the bake set you can get to go with it!
customer_reviews.author: G. Kruenegel

customer_reviews.title: A WELCOME ADDITION TO OUR CAMPING GEAR
customer_reviews.text: Very compact for easy storage on those camping trips where space is limited. Easy to assemble and use. Not sure how accurate the temperature gauge is but as we made our first batch of cornbread muffins, we were able to monitor the progress of the baking through the air vent slots on the side. When using it is important to have the oven centered on the right side burner. Very happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: Rodz

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!
customer_reviews.text: A campers hidden gem. Sometime the wheel just works! This Coleman oven is an old design which has been around for decades. It is no frills, and bears the original design from the 60's. Don't hesitate to get this and enjoy the ability to seriously elevate your campout cooking skills with this timeless, and somewhat forgotten gem of camp gear. I am rocking fresh biscuits and gravy in the middle of nowhere now!
customer_reviews.author: A. M. Larson

customer_reviews.title: Great Value and Love It
customer_reviews.text: This little oven was perfect for camping. It is so hard to cook and make things camping especially breakfast and keep your items warm. This oven did just that and we don't have a camp stove we have one of the roadtrip grills by coleman and it works just fine on that. The camp stoves may work better for wind deflection since most camp stoves have the wind flaps on the side that the roadtrip grill doesn't have but still didn't have any issues. Great value also.
customer_reviews.author: Bridget K Albright

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Bought used
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Bought used , but there was no damage. Works great. I use it on my gas stove instead of my microwave. Gas is cheaper than electric. I turn the burner to medium and it heats to 350 degrees in no time. Snacks heat up nicely. I have not used it for baking yet, but I think it will work well. As a child I saw my cousins use a full size version on their stove top, so I know they work well. Caution sticker is needed, as it is hot to touch, due to lack of insulation that normal ovens have. I'm thinking of getting a second one.
customer_reviews.author: esther a

customer_reviews.title: Great little oven for camping!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for when we go camping so that I can bake biscuits for what else. Biscuits and gravy! Also made from a mix, banana nut bread. Product works great, easy to use and fast delivery! Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: After the revelation that was fresh bread and fresh brownies ...
customer_reviews.text: After the revelation that was fresh bread and fresh brownies while camping, I would not go camping without this little guy!
customer_reviews.author: Book Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!!!  So glad I found this.
customer_reviews.text: Used it over a Coleman camp stove to heat taco dip and keep bacon warm. Worked great for those two uses. Did not try to bake yet, but it worked great for what I did with it. Folds down nicely for storage, and the temp gauge seemed to work well. Great purchase for camping.
customer_reviews.author: Jillian Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Great little oven!
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous camp oven! It sits perfectly on the Coleman stove and heats perfectly. Fresh baked muffins for breakfast were a treat while camping! It folds entirely flat for storage and travel.
customer_reviews.author: SBW

customer_reviews.title: The little oven that tries!
customer_reviews.text: This little oven is the greatest! I baked Fresh blueberry muffins In it while camping. They came out great. Negatives: did not get hotter than 275 degrees - disappointing - however, muffins did eventually come out golden and yummy. Took a while on high heat - used a bit of fuel but they worth it. We will experiment with Hotter fuel source. We used Coleman stove with 7500 BTU burner but oven did not fit well on burner - I will try a butane stove next time and am also investigating biomass stove to experiment with. Will update to see if little oven can achieve 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie S

customer_reviews.title: I like it.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure you would want to do a suflay in it but for camping it will work well. It is made to be way more durable than I expected, but kind of heavy. Even if you had to use a camp fire it would work. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this purchase! Used it for the first time this weekend and after a bit of trial and error it was perfect. Main lesson- low and slow. Tried cooking cinnamon rolls at the recommended 400 degrees and the bottom was charred. Kept it in the 350 range instead for muffins, checked a bit more frequently and turned out perfectly. So nice to have baked goods while camping! Used just add water muffin mix to reduce the amount of cooler space needed.
customer_reviews.author: mary

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Works like a charm... but t-stat is off 150 degrees (f)
customer_reviews.text: This works great! made muffins already and they turned out great! I also love how it folds down very compact. So why only 4 stars? the thermostat is way, way off... it said it was about 200 degrees (fahrenheit) and my laser infrared thermometer said it was about 350... not sure if i can figure out how to adjust t-stat, otherwise I would have given it 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Works as described, but notice the higher the rack is, the less likely the bottom of the food will be burnt. Once the trail and error period is over, it cooks all types of food great every time.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: worked good
customer_reviews.text: loved it. have to cook everything a bit slower or it tends to burn the bottom. but loved cooking fresh biscuits for my biscuits and gravy while camping.
customer_reviews.author: Freebie

customer_reviews.title: Will up your camp cooking game
customer_reviews.text: This oven is easy to set up and take down and becomes conveniently compact. It works great for baking and heating. The construction is a little cheap but with care it looks to last a long time. It would be better if another shelf were available for the oven, one shelf is not enough. I had to rig something up for the bottom of the oven so I could use it and the included wire shelf for a total of two shelves
customer_reviews.author: Charles Nicolet

customer_reviews.title: Really really awesome
customer_reviews.text: Oh this is an awesome thing to have,works really good.
customer_reviews.author: jeddown

product_meta.title: Coleman Camp Oven
product_meta.description:
Bring the joy of fresh-baked muffins, cinnamon rolls, cornbread, and other treats to any campsite with the Coleman Camp Oven. Designed to fit neatly on Coleman propane and liquid fuel camp stoves, this portable oven gives you the ability to bake treats or keep food warm while spending time outdoors. The included interior rack adjusts to 3 heights, while the easy-to-read thermometer lets you bake with confidence. This portable oven is made from smooth aluminized steel that resists corrosion and scratches and wipes clean easily, and it folds flat for convenient carrying and storage when it’s time to pack up camp.

AMAZON.COM
Camping stoves and other cooking accessories have made it possible to cook most things outdoors, but baked goods have always been out of the question. Until now, that is. Made of smooth aluminized steel, the Coleman camping oven lets you bake a batch of muffins, biscuits, or rolls right at the campsite. 



The Coleman camping oven is designed to sit on a two- or three-burner camping stove.The oven doesn't require electric or gas power to work. Instead, campers simply place the oven on top of a Coleman two- or three-burner stove, which provides all the heat you need to bake your favorite dishes. The oven also offers such baking essentials as an adjustable steel bake rack and an easy-to-read thermometer. And when you're done baking, the oven folds flat for easy storage. Made in China, the Coleman camping oven measures 12 by 12 by 12 inches (W x H x D) when standing and weighs 7 pounds.  About Coleman
More than 100 years ago, a young man with an entrepreneurial spirit and a better idea began manufacturing lanterns in Wichita, Kansas. His name was W.C. Coleman, and the company he founded would change life in America. A man plagued with such poor vision he sometimes had to ask classmates to read aloud to him, Coleman saw a brilliant light in 1900 in a drugstore window that stopped him in his tracks. He inquired about the light inside and discovered he was able to read even the small print on a medicine bottle by the illumination. The lamps had mantles, not wicks, and were fueled by gasoline under pressure instead of coal oil. Soon afterward, Coleman started a lighting service that offered a "no light, no pay" clause--a big step forward for merchants who were burned by inferior products that rarely worked--and drew substantial interest from businesses that wanted to keep their lights on after dark. 

 In the ensuing years, Coleman expanded its product line well beyond lanterns. The company's current catalog is thick with products that make spending time outdoors a pleasure. There are coolers that keep food and drinks cold for days on end, comfortable airbeds that won't deflate during the night, a complete line of LED lights that last for years, powerful portable grills that cook with an authentic open-grill flame, and much, much more. Coleman has truly fashioned much of our outdoor camping experience, and expects to do so for generations to come.
feature_bullets: Portable camping oven lets you bake with confidence at the campsite
Fits on Coleman Propane and Liquid Fuel Camp Stoves
Adjustable rack can be set at 3 heights for versatile baking
Easy-Clean Aluminum Steel Construction Resists Scratches and Corrosion
Folds flat for easy storage and carrying

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
